title: Happy Birthday, Meatball! NASA’s Iconic Logo Turns 65
summary: On July 15, 2024, NASA’s logo is turning 65. The iconic symbol, known affectionately as “the meatball,” was developed at NASA’s Lewis Research Center in Cleveland (now called NASA Glenn). Employee James Modarelli, who started his career at the center as an artist and technical illustrator, was its chief designer. The red, white, and blue […]

title: NASA Mission to Study Mysteries in the Origin of Solar Radio Waves
summary: NASA’s CubeSat Radio Interferometry Experiment, or CURIE, is scheduled to launch July 9, 2024, to investigate the unresolved origins of radio waves coming from the Sun. Scientists first noticed these radio waves decades ago, and over the years they’ve determined the radio waves come from solar flares and giant eruptions on the Sun called coronal […]

title: The Young Professional Satellite - From Theory to Reality (episode 2)
summary: In the second episode of this docu series, we take a closer look into what it took to build ESA’s Young Professional Satellite (YPSat). YPSat’s mission objectives are to capture the key moments of Ariane 6’s inaugural flight and take in-orbit pictures of Earth and space. To achieve this, the satellite requires the multiple sub-systems to work in harmony and adhere to a pre-defined mission sequence.

title: MDA Space taps Aerospacelab for satellite components
summary: Aerospacelab will supply more than 200 battery charge regulators for MDA’s new line of satellites

title: Scout Space selected for DARPA’s commercial tech initiative
summary: Under the BRIDGES (Bringing Classified Innovation to Defense and Government Systems) program, DARPA will sponsor Scout for a facility clearance, providing access to classified work areas and networks

title: NextSTEP Q: CIS Capability Studies III – Lunar User Terminals & Network Orchestration and Management System
summary: Solicitation Number: NNH16ZCQ001K-1_Appendix-Q-LUTNOMS July 8, 2024 – Solicitation Released Solicitation Overview NASA’s long-term vision to provide for a resilient space and ground communications and navigation infrastructure in which space mission users can seamlessly “roam” between an array of space-based and ground-based networks has been bolstered by innovative studies delivered by industry through the Next Space […]

title: NASA’s Begoña Vila Awarded 2024 Galician Excellence Award
summary: Begoña Vila, an instrument systems engineer for NASA’s James Webb Space Telescope, has been selected to receive the 2024 Galician Excellence Title in the Sciences and Medicine Category for her career and work on Webb. This award comes from the Spanish Association of Galician Entrepreneurs of Catalonia (AEGA-CAT), a civic and social organization of entrepreneurs […]

title: Orbital Defense Company Dark Completes Hot Fire Test Campaign
summary: Paris-based orbital defense company Dark has completed an initial hot fire test campaign for the combustion chamber of its Sheitan rocket engine. The engine will power the company’s air-launched Interceptor rocket. Founded in 2021, Dark initially planned to develop a multipurpose air-launched rocket. However, the company has since refashioned itself to focus on offering services […]

title: Juice's lunar-Earth flyby link to blog
Highlights from ESA’s first open day in the UK
summary: On Saturday 29 June, thousands of visitors made their way to ESA’s European Centre for Space Applications and Telecommunications (ECSAT), as part of the very first ESA open day to be held in the UK.
